column1: '''Halfred Greenhand''' was the son of [[Holman the greenhanded]].
Halfred was a gardener like his father, and the first to use his father's nickname as a family name. He had one son, whom he named after his father: [[Holman Greenhand
The name comes from [[Old English]] ''healfrēad'' "half-red, reddish" or from ''healfrǣd'' "half counsel".<ref>[[Jim Allan]], ''[[An Introduction to Elvish]]'', "Giving of names"</ref>
